amendment.description: Amendment withholds $65 million of the funds appropriated for the Andean Counterdrug Initiative until the Secretary of State submits to Congress a full report on the incident of April 20, 2001, in which Veronica "Roni" Bowers and her 7-month old daughter, Charity were killed when a Peruvian Air Force jet opened fire on their plane.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 44 printed in the Congressional Record to withhold $65 million of the funds appropriated for the Andean Counterdrug Initiative until the Secretary of State submits to Congress a full report on the incident of April 20, 2001, in which Veronica "Roni" Bowers and her 7-month old daughter, Charity were killed when a Peruvian Air Force jet opened fire on their plane.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Hoekstra amendment (A019) Agreed to by voice vote.
